У Portal 2 есть огромный, страшный, безобразный изъян. Её мало. 14 часов одиночной кампании и «коопа» пролетают мгновенно, словно летний сон. Рука так и тянется к «New Game», чтобы пройти игру снова, наслаждаясь умными головоломками и острыми, как лезвие бритвы, репликами героев. Но в одну реку не войти дважды — чертова память цепко держит каждую задачку. Остается слушать божественную арию из финального ролика и уповать на скорую амнезию.

Ez a legjobb logikai játék amit ismerek.A grafikája gyönyörű,a hangok tökéletesek,a játékélmény szórakoztató.
Nincs olyan amit ne kedvelnék benne.
Szerintem bárki kipróbálhatja,korhatár nélkül,nem nehéz játék,csak egy kis józan ész kell hozzá

Sequel TO A Sequel.

NOTE: PLAY THE FIRST GAME FIRST! IT'S A CLASSIC AND I STILL CONSIDER IT TO BE BETTER! 
I can't believe I forgot to write a review of this game! Well, let us just say that Portal 2 is a game unlike any other. It combines the always interesting portal gun mechanic with hilarious humor and a deep, incredible storyline that is left in mystery. The graphics fit the game very well, and are a great example of the full capacity of the Source Engine. The puzzles are fun and each one is different. They vary in difficulty, but none are so difficult that they cause frustration. The soundtrack is truely awe inspiring. I still find myself listening to "Science is Fun," "Bombs for Throwing at You," and the ending song among other great parts of the soundtrack (I recommend listening to the entire soundtrack if you ever have to study for something! It makes it MUCH better!). The co-op is some of the most fun I have ever had with my friends in videogames. It is funny, challenging (but not too challenging), and a good chunk of game that will take you and a partner a good while to complete (depending on how often you play). The Perpetual Testing Initiative was also a great addition, and allows you to try puzzles of many difficulty levels. There are also some awesome custom co-op campaigns. The game also has some cool mods to try, and there are many other interesting ones coming out soon. The only problem with the game is that it has no sense of replayability, although I really don't see that as much of an issue. A really fun thing to try is to make a friend who has never played the game try it. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. Overall, Portal 2 is easily one of the greatest games I have ever played, and is probably one of the best games ever created. Despite its greatness though, I still retain the opinion that the original Portal is better. Play it first. The stories link together strongly, and the atmosphere and feel to the original is extremely well developed. Portal 1 is some (mostly) serious art. Portal 2 is art with a splash of fun. Bottom line is, you have to play Portal 2, but you also have to play Portal 1 first.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jJQfIyd7zrU&list=UU7_-PLIhjsEBwIQXqKxmNpA

Portal 2 is a first person puzzle game with excellent physics challenges.
It is a second part of the story from the first Portal game.  The narrator
is dry and sarcastic, and very funny, and the story is well done; it helps
you propel through the game even when you are stumped by whatever puzzle
you may be working on.

The game performs smoothly, with will done level design.  The puzzles
are based off of manipulating the levels with a portal gun, as well as
using gravity and physics when necessary.  The difficulty and level design
progress in a balanced way, and does a great job of leading you in a linear
fashion, but leaving you to solve the puzzles on your own.  Awareness of
the details of the map is key.

For someone who likes puzzle games, this is an easy recommend.

The gameplay of Portal 2 is based on its predecessor Portal, where the player, with the use of portals, solves puzzles. New gameplay elements such as Mobility Gels, the Aerial Faith Plate and the Thermal Discouragement Beam were implemented as means for the player to master in order to solve puzzles.

I love this game. It oozes character, having a personality unlike anything else I've played. The first game was great, but the visual style, the story, and the characters make the sequel an even more enjoyable experience (for me). I have played and replayed this game more times than I can remember, and even once I could remember how to solve most puzzles, I still had a great time losing myself in the bizarre world of Aperture Science.

To top it all off, the level maker on PC is very fun and easy to use, and there's a ton of well designed puzzles out there if you're seeking a challenge.

不过主线中有些地图太大，真心找不到出口在哪里。。。

THIS GAME IS THE MASTERPIECE FROM VALVE

Played the first Portal of course! Great game and storyline. Thought I'm very late on Portal 2. It's been out for a long time now and I waited for a good time to buy. Purchsed it on sale for a good deal. (Even better then the Summer Sale price)

I was very pleased with the puzzles and gameplay in the first one so I did not watch any trailers or youtube any game play for Portal 2 because I knew I was going to enjoy the game no matter what. I'm very glad I finally made the purchse. Portal 2 was a short game like the first one but the storyline was truly awesome and I felt like my life was complete after seeing how it ended. 

I did like the fact that the game play was changed around a bit as in the "Paint" aspect of it. Threw me off guard with some of the solving. Had to think a little deeper to progress forward. I think i raged maybe a total of three times? Took a break then came back.

I beat the game within 10 hours to be exact. Same exact hours it took for Portal 1. 
To be fair and defend the shortness of Portal 2. I must say Valve added alot of goodies and extras to enjoy. Such as creating your own test chamers and making blue prints to upload to the community for others to play. 

Portal 2 also has an online Coop. You and a friend to tackle the test chamers. 
"Are you still there?"

Good! Now go purchse Portal 2 and enjoy :)

Ero rimasto piacevolmente colpito dal primo Portal, gran bel puzzle game in prima persona che si basa su un concetto semplice ma è tutto tranne che banale, con dei tocchi veramente di classe da parte di Valve (indimenticabile la canzone Still Alive come ciliegina sulla torta...la ciliegina non è una bugia tranquilli).

Con il suo seguito Valve è semplicemente riuscita a fare ancora meglio: buona longevità, belle musiche, modalità cooperativa, grandissima cura per i dettagli, easter eggs e una trama tragi-comica da oscar, con dei personaggi che non possono non lasciare qualcosa.

E ovviamente non mancano le creazioni amatoriali come valore aggiunto.

Perfetto? Quasi, secondo me si poteva arrivare a un livello di difficoltà maggiore nel single player, ma dettagli davanti a un'opera di questa qualità.
非常棒的游戏！
